title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. The fraud trial of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes got underway. Who's her lawyer?

A. Reid Weingarten

B. David Boies

C. Kevin Downey

D. Alan Dershowitz

---

2. Economist Kenneth Rogoff argued that the 1999 book "Dow 36,000" was right after all. Who were the authors?

A. James Grant and Paul Ehrlich

B. Stephanie Kelton and William Jennings Bryan

C. Jeremy Siegel and John Bogle

D. James Glassman and Kevin Hassett

---

3. Bill Gates agree to buy control of a renowned hospitality chain. Which?

A. Motel 6

B. Four Seasons

C. St. Regis

D. Mandarin Oriental

---

4. Many men are giving up on college. About what proportion of U.S. college students are women?

A. 40%

B. 50%

C. 60%

D. 70%

---

5. A Libyan warlord has hired former Bill Clinton aide Lanny Davis and which GOP ex-congressman to lobby for support?

A. Robert Livingston

B. John Boehner

C. Newt Gingrich

D. Paul Ryan

---

6. What do health experts expect to make a big comeback this year?

A. Auto fatalities

B. Heart attacks

C. Influenza

D. Espadrilles

---

7. A 7.1-magnitude earthquake struck near a Mexican resort city. Which one?

A. Acapulco

B. Puerto Vallarta

C. Cancun

D. Cabo San Lucas

---

8. A coup in mineral-rich Guinea sent prices sharply higher -- for what?

A. Steel

B. Silver

C. Platinum

D. Aluminum

---

9. "Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings" broke records for the highest-grossing film for the four-day Labor Day weekend. Which studio released it?

A. Disney

B. Universal

C. Sony

D. Warner

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. D

3. B

4. C

5. A

6. C

7. A

8. D

9. A
